meanings.definition: Be silent, morose, and bad-tempered out of annoyance or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, Tim would sulk in the corner, refusing to talk to anyone.
meanings.sent2: She tends to sulk whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: When the cat didn't get the treat, it decided to sulk in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to sulk in the sky, ready to burst at any moment.
meanings.sent5: His sulk was so intense, it filled the room with a heavy atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: After the argument, there was a long sulk between the two friends.
meanings.sent2: Her sulk lasted for hours before she finally cheered up.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's sulk over not getting candy was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The sulk of the rainy weather matched his gloomy mood.
meanings.sent5: The silent sulk in the room made everyone feel uneasy.
